page.title: 13PEEL PARK, BRADFORD
page.content: Peel Park,named after Sir Robert Peel, was the {first publicly owned park in {Bradford.}Paid for by subscription, it was given to the Corporation in{1863. Within its 52 acres is much open space, many flower beds and a lake. Young children can enjoy the two play areas with swings and slides. There are facilities for summer sports such as{ bowling, tennis & putting,} while {rugby & football} are catered for in winter. A cafe serves hot & cold snacks and provides seating inside and out. Visiting entertainments include fairs and a circus. {The Bradford {Marathon}started from here in 1985. The new nursery, with its{computer {controlled greenhouses, }was finished in 1982 & produces almost \million plants to be used in the grounds and at Civic functions throughout the City.
